Yellow Truck

I have been experimenting a lot with more realistic shaders and modeling and am really happy with this personal project I started and finished over Labor Day weekend. First, the final image:

Credits & Resources

  • HDRi image by Greg Zaal/Adaptive Samples
  • Fingerprint and scratch maps by Hexbob6 via StackExchange
  • Procedural soil shader by CgAlpha via Blendswap
  • Grass Essentials by Blender Guru. Pricey, but worth the time saved!
  • A Node Wrangler refresher, again by Greg Zaal, can be really helpful once you’re dealing with clumps of 4 or 5 mix nodes.
  • This tip by AbdouBouam on dA about using Geometry/Pointiness instead of dirty vertex colors.
  • How to model a car tire by Blender Guru. This is different than the videos currently in his tutorial on modeling an entire car wheel, but check that out if you’re modeling rims.

Next post: notes and process.
